Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on .
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is required.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions.
In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please
contact the area manager at 616-552-3662.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R400-4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications.
Rule 112. (1) Child caring institutions subject to 42 USC 671 shall not permit a
child caring institution staff member to begin working unless all of the following
has been completed using the forms, and in the manner, prescribed by the
department:
(a) A criminal record check as reference in R400,4113(f) including a fingerprint-
based check of national criminal information databases, unless an
alternative criminal history check has been approved by the federal
government.

Two out of nine new hire files did not have a criminal record check completed prior to
starting work.
(Repeat Violations-Interim Report 2022 CAP 08/15/222)
R400-4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications.
Rule 112. (1) Child caring institutions subject to 42 USC 671 shall not permit a
child caring institution staff member to begin working unless all of the following
has been completed using the forms, and in the manner, prescribed by the
department:
(b) A check of Michigan’s child abuse and neglect central registry or Canadian
provincial agency as reference in R400.4113(i).
Two out of nine employee files reviewed central registry checks were completed late.
(Repeat Violations-Interim Report 2022 CAP 08/15/222)
R400.4113 Employee records.
Rule 113. An institution shall maintain employee records for each employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following information prior to
employment or at the time specified in the rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to employment form
persons unrelated to the employee and which are less than 12 months old.
One of nine new hire files did not have three dated references obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and which are less than 12
months old.
R400.4113 Employee records.
Rule 113. (1) An institution shall maintain employee records for each employee
and shall include documentation of all of the following information prior to
employment or at the time specified in the rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee’s performance within 30 days of the
completion of the probationary period or within 180 days, whichever is less, and
a written evaluation of the employee’s performance annually thereafter.
One of the three employee files did not have a written evaluation of the employee’s
performance within 30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within 180-
days whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the employee’s performance
annually thereafter.

Rule 4000.4115 First Aid; CPR.
Rule 115. A person certified within the preceding 36 months in first aid and within
the preceding 24 months in age-appropriate cardiopulmonary resuscitation by the
American Red Cross, the American Heart Association, or an equivalent
organization or institution.
One of the nine employees’ files reviewed did not have a the First Aide and CPR
certification.
R400.4166 Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all of the following
information shall be documented in the case records within 14 days after
discharge:
(a)The date of and reason for discharge, and the new location of the child.
(a-f) One of three files reviewed was missing the discharge plan.
(f) One of three youths were missing the name and official title of the person to
whom the resident was discharged.
(Repeat Violations-Interim Report 2022 CAP 08/15/222)
R400.4152 Initial documentation
At the time of admission, all of the shall be in the resident’s case record.
(e) date of admission and legal status
One of the three youths’ files reviewed for treatment was missing legal status.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was offered on maintaining and organizing the
employee/HR files should be separated by sections to assist with the audit
process and ensure compliance with the rule.
• Current director is overseeing both facilities, so it was again suggested that the
agency needs a director assigned to each facility.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation provided regarding the completion of the room monitoring forms
need to reflect the 15-minute variable intervals checks that is being done not
the way it is listed on the logs every 15 minutes.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submit one corrective action plans during this period under review.
SIR 2022C0446034 intake date 07/13/2022, CAP approved 09/09/2023, involved
three staff holding a youth on the floor for approximately 5 minutes which is not the
agency physical management technique that staff are trained to utilize. The
corrective action plan included terminating the supervisior involved and restraining
staff on crisis intervention procedures.
Financial Overview
The financial report was reviewed and showed no concerns.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
The agency is compliant with PREA.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was completed and submitted for review. The
facility voluntarily closed from August of 2022 to May of 2023. There have been no
restraints completed since the facility reopened. The assessment indicated an
appropriate plan for continued monitoring of compliance with contract and rules.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed who reported feeling very supported, participating in training, and
feel that the facility is meeting the needs of the youths. I interviewed youths who
reported feeling safe, receiving therapy, enough food, medication, and all their
needs are being met. Youths reported having good relationship with staff and
expressed no concerns.

Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on 07/25/2023. I
observed the youths' bedrooms, shower area, medication room, control room,
classrooms, kitchen, meal menu, and reviewed room monitoring sheets.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
